text:
So apparently there is another Verrazano location on Rainbow which has been around for about thirty years and is run by the same owner it opened with, who is himself a New York Italian. I made the mistake of thinking this was that. It's not that.

The pizza was not bad enough to send back, but bad enough to not finish. What I had today on a Saturday morning was a poseur of a slice. Yeah, it's thin and crispy enough to fold in half. No, it doesn't taste like a serious pizza chef made it. Couldn't tell who the chef was, but the only guy behind the counter was a young Hispanic guy. It tasted about as good as you'd expect if you went in thinking you'd get a thirty+ year veteran chef and got a young Hispanic guy instead.

Either today was a serious off day, or the five star reviews you're seeing on this page were meant to be written for the Verrazano on Sunset. I'm considering my five bucks a donation to a local business rather than money paid for a meal.

Living in the valley for over seven years now and still can't find a decent delivery pizza. While customer service was good and delivery was swift, the pizza fell extremely short. Had pepperoni and sausage. The pizza was very greasy and sorry, but I've had better in a cafeteria or food court. So we will keep on looking...
I love the pizza here.. we are from NY and just totally enjoy coming here for our pizza fix.. easy parking.. convenient location.. great people there
Fantastic pizza, plenty of cheese, crispy crust and the staff is so nice. Good for quick lunch or to go orders. Our favorite neighborhood pizza place.
I used to love this place.  I just went in recently and the older dude with an accent was a complete dick. They never have any slices ready. If you want shitty service, then this is your place.

I am rating this place a 5 because of their great customer service. The pizza was delicious and I would give it 4 stars.

Went last night with a friend, ordered a medium veggie pizza with two sodas. They took the pizza to our table and it was really good! Thin, crispy, and hot! An older gentleman took napkins, offered us cheese and pepper and put them on our table -without us having to ask. As well as refills. They seem to care about their customers. To be honest I love pizza and I've tried a lot but their pizza was good especially their crunchy crust. Not to mention that nothing was burned or over/under cooked either. Nice friendly & attentive :)
By far the best pizza in Las Vegas. I've lived here for two years and mad I only just discovered it recently.

great classic Vegas pizza place.  Growing up, it seemed like there were plenty of these kinds of places with great pizza, great chicken fingers, great wings, french fries, etc.   Now it seems like most places skimp on the quality of ingredients.  

The portions are large, the toppings are plentiful and full of flavor.  The chicken fingers are great, the ranch tastes fresh, and the fries are good traditional pizza fries.

Me and my husband have been coming here for years. He says its closest to pizza back home (east coast) he has found out here.  Everything we have a tried on the menu has been delicious.  They also remember their regulars, always nice and polite.  Also their ranch sauce is seriously good, always have to get an extra.

Not bad. Best as a decent take out. Crust was too hard but a good taste. Dining room is a few booths and tables and was not air-conditioned very well but hay, your there for the pizza and garlic knots.
I really like Verrazano's. The pizza is delicious (for west coast pizza). When ordering delivery the crust could be crispier but other than that we enjoy everything we have tried on the menu.

The pizza is average just typical Las Vegas pizza nothing special.  The delivery was horrible.  The driver comes to my door the bill is $22 I only have $40 the driver says he don't have change and is just expecting the whole $40.  Can you explain to me how a delivery driver has no change for a $20.  The feel at the door was that I felt like I was being hustled.  I send the food back and refuse to order from there again.  I called the store and spoke with the manager and he never apologized nothing the entire experience sucked.

Tried the pepperoni pizza and a Philly cheesesteak w/ fries today and both were great!! Authentic NY style pizza and the cheesesteak was very tasty! I got onions and peppers on my cheesesteak and I also had ranch to dip my fries and sandwich in. The wait time is long because they actually make the food fresh when you order it, which is a great thing and very well worth it.

We got the Verrazano pizza, garlic knots, and plain chicken wings.  First off the pizza was good.  It was greasy but the meats on it were delicious.  

Garlic knots were not that great.  It was burnt and dry.  

Chicken wings were also Ok.  We got plain which I would think it would at least be seasoned with salt but it literally was plain no flavor.  So we ordered some ranch to give it some flavor. 

Customer service was alright.
Great food and equal service.  This place kind of reminds me of what the ideal New York pizzeria should look and feel.  I'll definitely return there.

I have been eating here for years. The employees are always nice and while the dining area can be hot (it is small and there is a GIANT pizza oven 10 ft away) it is a pretty relaxed environment. If you're a regular, they do recognize you-which is rare. I haven't been to their other location but this one is great.

Under new management
What a way to ruin an excellent establishment. We have been customers of Verrazano's for years, but tonight was the end of that relationship. 
The pizza was smaller and the crust tasted like cardboard with tomato sauce on it. It was worse than school pizza. The wings were supposed to be medium and extra crispy, they were not. Our food has always been ready on time, but tonight we waited an additional 20 minutes. To top it off the new management has decided to charge 3% if you choose to use you debit/credit card. This is no longer the Verrazano's we loved.

Pizza is SO SO SO GOOD. Some of the BEST NY style pizza I've had on the west coast. The SAUCE is seasoned, obviously someone's special recipe. Crust is thin but still crispy, yeah you can fold it. Pasta is BOMB also but every time I order I have to get pizza. Try the calzones-pretty damn authentic. It brings back nostalgic tastes of home.
Great pizza! We make it our 1st meal whenever were in town. It's consistently good and we have been coming here for years.

The food is amazing. Customer service is OK. sort of. 

I came in for lunch with a friend. We had no idea what to expect, so of course I check the reviews and I see they got great ones!  So, we decided to check it out.  I stood for a while staring at the menu because I didn't know what to order. It wasn't that there were too many or too little amount of items to choose from, but they all sounded delicious. I decided on 1 slice of mushroom pizza and the lunch special chicken wings. It was a pretty good deal.  My friend's food came out first. She ordered the meatball sub and fried ravioli.  (The ravioli appetizer is to die!) My slice of pizza finally came out but I didn't want to start eating until all my food was ready... Waiting.... Waiting.. Waiting............ My wings took forever!!! I ended up taking a few bites of my pizza while I wait for the rest. Pizza was amazing!!! Crust. Perfect. Cheese. Perfect. Mushrooms. Perfect. I usually dip my pizza in ranch but I didn't even need it. With the pizza almost done.. STILL waiting on wings. My friend finished eating before my food even came out; such an inconvenience!  I would give this place more stars if I didn't have to wait so long just for an order of chicken wings. Did they have to hunt down the chicken first?

The relaxed atmosphere was the first thing I noticed about this place. This is a no-nonsense pizzeria. Simple anesthetics and good food. I had the chicken parmesan sub, one of the best I've ever had. You should swing by this place if you can.

EUREKA I FOUND IT! After some bad experiences with other nearby pizza places, I finally found the bomb.com meatball sandwich! The bread was soft yet crispy, meatballs big and flavorful, and Oh-em-gee the cheese. The last place I ordered a meatball sub from didn't even give it to cheese, but Verrazano made up for it with deliciously melted mozzarella. The fried ravioli appetizer was delish too. My friend got the hot wings that I didn't try, but the hot sauce smelled AMAZEBALLS and made my mouth water. We finally found the spot for our lunch time marinara cravings.

Use to be a great place to dine in chill as a former employee it was great work environment we were all family here until original owner Phil Ruffino broke his promise to us that we would be first ones considered if the business was for sale to have a chance to purchase it so we stayed loyal to him for 5 plus years then he sells it under us without even informing us until we see mail of new ownership and the  schmucks came in trying make it known prior to transfer ownership starting stuff and got one of our drivers fired which was loyal to the business and then we lost some customers due to his loss and lost chris our best pizza maker - manager then the place went Down hill after the  schmucks took it over month ago changing up the recipes which for 40 years it's been the same cause our motto is it never sucked and then trying fire the original crew which we all quit because of new owner Ryan shady business taking out taxes federal medical and social from our paychecks without even knowing our social security to pay the taxes he taking out and charging our loyal customers the tax price and adding tax on top . Business became shady so we all left before IRS and stuff comes in for shady business and sad all our customers now get charged the merchant fee for using credit card. This new guy is savage on taxing customers all types of hidden fees. To all our loyal customers that knew me Carlos Antonio Chris Jose Sean we all appreciate your loyalty and for not coming back there after we all departed we are in process of opening our own shop shortly to keep recipe the same the real New York Brooklyn style pizza y'all known for last 40 years in Las Vegas. Sad how new ownership turned this place from a friends and family style environment that our customers loved to just a regular type business style place like a dominos or pizza hut.  Help boycott this place and make this guy bankrupt like his last business for being a shady pos  schmuck

Sooooooo sad Verrazano Pizza is gone!!!!!! I miss this place soooo much I don't know what happened, one day I'm ordering pizza and the next I call and it's some other pizza place! Man I miss their ranch, it was really something special.
Spicy chicken strips were awesome and they have a homemade ranch i loved. Also got a pizza pie with everything.. real cheese! Crust was super crispy for having all those toppings

I told myself a few years ago I wouldn't go back. I gave you one more shot. Never again! 
Meatball sandwich had two, two meatballs cut in half to make a sandwich. Cheap Fu*cks! All for $8.0.
Eat here all the time. Pizza is great, service is great. Sometimes you have to wait a little bit but I don't mind cause we love the pizza. We would recommend to anyone.

This place is amazing. Not only is the pizza awesome, but the service is amazing. I'm from Brooklyn and this is really the closest you can get to NY pizza in Vegas. I got a large cheese pizza and a calzone and both were cheesy and wonderful. And the man the delivered to me was quite a gentleman. I will not only be back but I will tell everyone about it. Just all around great.

My girlfriend goes to the massage therapy school M-F from 7-1030 & im visiting from TX so of course I wait to see her whenever I can.  So today I was craving Pizza as her daughter had mentioned it before we left for her to go to school.  So seeing and I thought I try them out and boy was I not disappointed.  I got the anchovy by the slice and pepperoni by the slice and both were truly amazing deathly try this place out.  Not to mention the gentleman that worked the counter was extremely nice and was open to any questions I had concerning what they offered.

Literally a slice of New York in Las Vegas!!!! Man I love this place !  I feel like I'm in Brooklyn getting a slice with my homies except the weather is nicer lol!!! I definitely recommend this place the food is awesome and the prices are great!!! Come on down !!!!

We were visiting the area and found this place on yelp. I love NY style pizza and this reminds me of that. I would recommend this place. Plenty of booths to sit at inside. Everything was priced right as well. I don't live there, but if I did this would become a regular for me.

One of the best pizzas we have had from take out the ziti pizza is THE BOMB. Creamy sauce, chewy and crunch dough with a yummy crust......ultimate comfort pizza.......now all I need to do is find somewhere that makes a mac and cheese pizza......hint hint.

I work in the same shopping center as this place, and finally decided to try it today. My boyfriend grew up eating at their sister store, and always loved it. So, I decided to order some hot chicken fingers and fries. I was so sad and disappointed when I got back to work and saw they put almost NO sauce on the fingers! They're just not good. Then, to top it off, there's literally no salt on the fries. I don't indulge very often, so this was a special treat, and I'm extremely disappointed. I don't have time to take it back, since I'm on break. But, I definitely won't be going back.

Went to Verrazano Pizza today for lunch, and the service was great! The gentleman behind the counter was very polite and kept coming over to ask if we needed anything and offered us refills on our drinks. Not bad considering I paid the same amount for my meal that I would have for a cheap fast food lunch! Good job Verrazano, I will be returning for lunch again!

We have been going here for the last 3 yrs & this my 1st review. This review will be on "Pizza" only. Being in the restaurant business I have tasted so many different pizzas. For me & my family Verrazano's pies are excellent, pizza is simple & sometimes simple is the best.

Tasty, but some of the greasiest pizza I've ever seen. Literally orange it was so greasy. 
Also, the delivery driver didn't carry cheese or peppers with him because they are "by request only"

So at least now we know that 1, we need to request cheese or peppers when we order and 2, we should find out what's up with the grease and see if they can do something about that.
I recently tried Verrazano Pizza hoping that it would take me back to my hometown, Brooklyn N.Y.  The pizza was very good- crisp crust, gooey cheese and foldable.  Will be returning.
Really good food for reasonable prices. The ownership cares about their customers which will always bring my family back. Thanks again for a great meal and a genuine caring for excellent service!
This is my new favorite pizza joint! The ingredients are always fresh and the pizza taste amazing! Definitely will recommend
My new favorite pizza place! Verrazano Pizza not only has delicious, authentic food but the service is stellar. We will be back soon!

I went here thinking it was still Verrazano Pizza. Very disappointed to hear it's been taken over by new owners. I ordered 2 slices of pepperoni for pick up. Got home and they gave me two pieces of cheese. It looked very unappealing. I immediately took it back. The new place is called IDK Craft Pizza or something?  DO NOT GO HERE. YUCK.

Wife and I tried this place (delivery) since it was close and got good reviews. I have to say it was some of the worst pizza I've had in a while. I would easily prefer digiorno over this. The toppings were bland and the pizza dough was very hard and stale tasting. Unfortunate since I was really hoping it would be good with how close it is.

Here is another one of my top places for pizza delivery. I have decided only to rate my favorite places on yelp. And this pizza joint is one of the best. I order the large cheese and fingers with ranch. I have read some of the one star reviews and have to say "REALLY"??? Come on Man!!!! Don't order stupid things like meatballs. It is a PIZZA Joint! Not a Meatballs Joint! Come on everyone who 1 stars business that specialize in Pizza but get  1 stars for stupid things like meatballs. Use some common sense. Got a nice local Italian place like the Bootlegger for meatballs.

You get what you pay for, this is delicious greasy new york style pizza. Our first pizza joint when we first moved here, they deliver and satisy that urge for greasy cheesy pizza! I would not waste your money on teh wings, they are not very good but their garlic knots are pretty good is they have any left when you are ordering your food. I heard they have great lunch specials too!

Lovelovelove this place.  

It's not for everyone though.  This is a NY/NJ style pizzeria.  You don't go here to eat-in unless you're stopping for a few slices at lunch.  Its the kind of place you went to when you cut gym senior year of high school.  The kind of place where you smell the ovens from outside and there's always an employee/family member sitting at one of the tables folding boxes.  If I remember right its owned by some guys from Staten Island.

I hadn't been here in a long time since moving out of GV, but now I work in the area so I stopped in for lunch.  They have a good lunch special ($4.95/ 2 slices and a drink).  The pizza was a little overdone but was still better than most of the shitty pizza here in the valley. 

I used to order stuffed shells and some other dishes and everything was always top notch.  This is Italian food made by Italians.

All in all one of the better joints in town.

This place is a pizza-gem in Las Vegas. I'm a regular here for lunch- 2 slices of cheese and a drink for less than $5. The cheese pizza is awesome, perfect amount of crisp to the dough and never overly greasy. The fried raviolis are a must have extra to any order. They come with marinara sauce and about 10 in each order. This place is family owned with friendly faces every time. The delivery times are quick and pick up is always on time. I've also order the lasagna pizza and Hawaiian- but these order were a little overwhelming with the toppings which made the pizza a little difficult to handle. Classic cheese or pep is the way to go.

This place is a solid little neighborhood  pizza joint. Cheap, fresh, and quick pies. Guy behind the counter is really nice. Always asks me if I want a drink while I wait for my pizza. Haven't had any apps except mozzarella stix but they are good too. This place is a great option when I don't feel like cooking on a Sunday night.

Great pizza but absolutely rude customer service. I walked in after calling and they completely ignored us and all three were working or doing something at the front while standing straight in front of them. He was rude older man who just looked up after five minutes said hello as if we are intruding and turns around and continues until about 5min standing there says can I help you. Ugh.

The only bad thing living in NY is I am spoiled from the great tasting food they have there and that's why most of my reviews I knock places here in Vegas because I am spoiled. So when I give 5 stars to a pizza joint which I rarely do, you know I am one happy camper. Try this place out, trust me you will not be disappointed.



Now review on this NEW and Improved Verrazanos WOW! Thank you Ryan for taking over this place, the pizza from old owners here was terrible, I live right around the corner and I would have to travel 5 miles to get decent pizza with this NEW owner that took over (RYAN) , guys let me tell you this, from living in NYC all my life, and tasting the best pizza, this place is for sure hands down best pizza I ever tasted living here in Vegas, I also have buddy's that lived in NY, and Chicago they told me about the great tasting pizza they have here and they are RIGHT! Everything here is made from scratch, no frozen stuff in here, the tomato sauce Home made and man can you taste the different. The owner Ryan is a great guy, Ryan is not New to making pizzas, being a New Yorker him self Ryan food is excellent he takes pride in what he does, and guys it shows, it really does.

Now that I found a great pizzeria here in Vegas, can I now find one of those Mom and pop pastry shops they have in NY, man I miss them
Found this place because we were so hungry and it was on the way home. So glad we grab some pizza. Friendly people and great pizza! Definitely, a great stop to grab some pizza!

Been coming to this place for decades always very consistent great sandwiches and their chicken fingers are awesome.... They always have some kind of special going on that will get you a ton of food for not so much dough:)

Born and raised in New York. Go every year and always have pizza cause I figure it will be the last New York Pizza until I get back. Been out on west coast for 50 years. Happen to be in Smiths center and thought I'd try a slice of cheese, the true test of new York style pizza. Could not believe it. Was exactly like New York. Sauce, cheese, crust! I thought I was having a hallucination! Will be back to try the Italian sausage and meatballs.
THANK YOU LORD!!!!!

Not good at all we tried this place 2 times it's horrible the mozzarella sticks are frozen I do get places use frozen stuff but plz cook them right the pizza it's crazy bad you are better off with Pizza Hut
I just love that specialty spinach ricotta pizza!

Location is Eastern and Windmill in the Smith's Shopping Center. Lots of people walking into this place (good sign!) The sign out front advertised a large cheese pizza special for $9.99 (sweet deal!) Always skeptical of reviewers saying pizza tastes like New York pizza. I get excited just to be disappointed but the pizza was pretty good and it is close to the pizza you get in New York. Look forward to trying EVERYTHING on the menu. So happy we found this place THANKS FELLOW YELPERS!!
Pizza reminds me of East Coast pizza. Mice size and fairly priced. Delivery took about 10mins longer than predicted.
Ryan and his crew awesome customer service..great food   My favorite the chicken wings..

The ranch is the best thing here! The people working here aren't the friendliest but the pizza is pretty good, ESPECIALLY dipped in their ranch. They dont have a restroom for customers, you would have to walk all the way across the parking lot to smiths if you really got to go. Not really an ideal situation when you come to eat with smaller children.

Very good, but not quite NY style. Thin crust, Sicilian, Stromboli. Very small eating area. Most of their business has to be pick-up. The bakers are a little rude. The pizza is a little greasy, but I don't mind. The crust is probably in the top 5 crusts in North East LV.
They would be a perfect 3 1/2 stars.

Extremely friendly people. I had my toddler on one arm and the elderly man helped me bring it to my car while I got my baby in. Must I mention he opened up both doors to help me. 
Now the pizza and ranch are to die for. After a long day at work and ran few errands. This was seriously cherry to the Sunday! 
Will MOST DEF! Tell people about it and will come eat here too. Thank you for the amazing costumer service.

No complaints. Excellent pizza - had half cheese and half "buffalo chicken" - it wasn't their true specialty buffalo chicken which has a different sauce base, but a full red sauce pie with buffalo seasoned chicken chunks on half. Chicken was good, not overcooked, crispy. A bit too salty though. 
Crust wasn't soggy, had a chewy crunch; stood up pretty well as a good NY slice should. I travel to Vegas for work and as of now, this is my go to spot for pizza. It's good enough that I probably won't keep looking for alternatives.

Honestly I can't believe I'm going to say this but this place has "THE BEST" Hot Wings I've ever had my entire life. I've tried many places traveling and this place is hands down the best place to get Hot Wings. Finger licking good! Wings were nice size too and what I loved about the taste of the hot wings was that it was definitely hot enough to where I didn't even have to add any extra hot sauces or ranch and it was still good. The flavor of the chicken was on point too. Looking forward to trying more stuff on their menu.
Great hole in the wall NY style pizza place!! The subs and pizza are amazing and the prices are reasonable. I would give them 5 stars if they offered a few more entree selections!

Driving around town, I started to crave for something cheesy. So pizza it was! I yelped for a pizza place close to where we were and this place came up! Boyfriend and I walked in and were greeted by the workers. We didn't catch the guys' name, but he was nice. Well he actually came off rude at first, but only because he was so serious and short with his words. But people have different personalities and he was one of those who R actually very nice, & a bit funny in his own way. I work retail at the airport, so I pick up on different personalities and attitudes pretty quick. Anyways, the pizza was good. Bf ordered me an extra cheesy slice, so they added more cheese. He ordered himself a meatball pizza, and they actually added slices of real meatball! Lol. The place itself looked like it was a hole in the wall in little Italy New York. I'd definitely come back here again. :)

Best pizza!!friendly and prompt service pizza is always fresh and hot when it's delivered!!
Definitely generous on the toppings

New management is better they treat first responders and military great! The owner goes beyond what I expected. My son love their cheese pizza and my wife love their pizza dough. This is my one stop NY style pizza and wings! Try the white pizza it's great too! I feel bad for the old employees though they seem to be bitter about what happened again this place is great pizza place and don't let the bad reviews stop you especially majority of them are from the old management.

First, let me start of by saying that their pizza is among the best in the city. That being said, the place is poorly managed and understaffed. The last 3 times I got a pizza there, I had to wait at least 15 minutes after the time they told me my pizza would be ready. Tonight, I was told my pizza would be ready in 35 minutes. I arrived 40 minutes later and the pizza cook told me that mine would be the next one he puts in the oven and it would be another 20 minutes.  He said that he got a lot of orders all at once and mine was the last one. If he knew that, he should have told me it would be an hour from the start. I would have waited, and been less irritated. I don't blame it on the cook, but rather on the management. They should know that they need adequate staffing to handle the volume of business that they get. Especially on a Sunday night during football season! I love the pizza, but this is probably the last time that I will be back.

UPDATE: I have been back several times since I wrote my review, and the service has improved immensely. The pizza is very good and you no longer have to wait forever for your order to be ready. Grade increased to 4stars.

If you're looking for the best NY Pizza in Vegas look no further than Verrazano.  Pies are made to order and the wings are crispy and delicious.  They also serve up tasty sandwiches and pasta.  This is the best east coast pizzeria out west.

I order from here all the time. The pizza takes me back to when I was in high school and we used to run to a different pizza place by the school and get a slice for $1. MMMMMmmmmm. Nothing fancy, just plain old take out pizza. I like it.
$75 for 50 small wings and didnt  even come with cerlery and carrots. We will no go back
Pizza is excellent, coming from new york I have had the best pizzas on the planet and these guys know how to make a pie 2 thumbs way up. ..

I was craving New York style pizza tonight and I am so glad we came here! It is exactly what I needed! Gooey cheesey pie with very friendly service and very casual and clean environment. Crust was great along with sauce and cheese. Not too greasy, just right! I am looking forward to coming back and trying the ziti.

Holy mother of pizza heaven, in all of my years of pizza eating this was by far the best I've ever had! We ordered the Verrazano (like a supreme) and all the meats and veggies married in my mouth with the right amount of cheese and crust....light and thin....tasty and delicious:))) Im glad a friend told me to try this place, it is right around the corner from my house and if i was never told how good it was I would have never tried it. I have a few places that I go for pizza and stick to them, this is now first on my list:)

Now IDK, real New York!! Real family owned ! All new staff ! Nothing frozen. They got east cost manhattan coffee,
Sodas ! Omg  more specials! Save money !who loves yeah baby! Eat your heart out Amore' this is really the real deal!!!
I was born and raised in New York and I have to say that the Pizza from Verrazano is exactly like I'd get back home!!! Love this place!! I'd highly recommend it to everyone that enjoys a good pizza.

Ordered to go: everything was ready by the 25 minutes I got there. I'm obsessed with thin crust and full flavour, and this place definitely lived up to my expectations. The two people there are experienced dough-flipping-spinning people with awesome skills. Just a little pricey, but I didn't expect  excellent Las Vegas pizza to be cheap.

Friend and I went into this shop which smelled terrible upon entering and ordered 2 slices of cheese pizza. The male at the counter who took our order, grabbed two slices of what appeared to be old pizza with his bare hands and placed the slices in the oven. After seeing this we cancelled our order and left the shop.  Super disgusting.

Verrazano's is in the rotation for carryout pizza & wings in the area. I think the pizza is good, not great, and I don't really like the wings (too greasy), but my husband does. I think it's a 3 star place, but after my last experience, I won't be back, and almost want to lower it to one star. 

We ordered a pizza and wings for pickup and the man on the phone said it would be ready in 25 minutes. Show up to pick up the goods and there's a man in front of us trying to order a couple slices to eat in. 

The cashier/order taker/pizza maker behind the counter says, "Oh, we're out of slices tonight." (approx. 5:30pm on a Friday night). 

Customer: Ok, then we'll just get a whole pie.
Counter Guy: Welll....I've got a lot of orders ahead of you. It's gonna be a while.
Customer: Like how long?
Counter Guy: Oh....at least an hour and a half.
 
Obviously, these customers leave, unhappy with their experience.
 
Our turn.
 
Husband: Hey, we have an order for pickup.
Counter Guy: Oh man...I haven't even started making it yet (5 mins after we were told it would be ready)
Husband: Ok - well how much longer is it going to be?
Counter Guy: I don't know. There's a lot of orders ahead of you.
 
Wow! We had to cancel our order and go to Pizza My Dear on Warm Springs instead. I would be kinda pissed any time if I was told it would take an hour and a half to make a pizza for carryout (it's not like it was the super bowl or something), but especially when I called ahead and you told me less than 30 minutes!! Sorry, Verrazano's, I won't be back to give you another chance.

We were happy to see that this location was open as well. This is one our favorite NY Style pizza places. We got a slice of cheese, and a slice of pepperoni. Not too much grease, and super thin crust. I am glad that this location is not just right around the corner from my house, otherwise I might have a problem with my 'diet'.

Walked in at 1pm Lunch time, NO HELLO, a sourpuss big guy just starred at us, he was the only worker, No other customers, food looked old & Dry. Pizza was Dry, Old. And reheated. Place looked dirty, had No other business, all other places close by where busy, it was lunch time. Stale Pizza ! Unhappy miserably sad worker. We left him looking for his VOICE & PERSONALITY ! Maybe it's under the Verranzano bridge in BKLYN ! Old DRY Food, too bad.
Come here and get pizza  it's by the slice or whole. Great place for a lunch date, or while you're waiting for a massage at the massage school next door

Verrazano is gone and tonight we ordered a pizza and it looked like a 6th grade home ec experiment. We also ordered wings and they were swimming in grease. Loved their ranch dressing from the past and the new owners gave nothing. Afraid this place will be gone soon. Verrazano come back please!!!

i found this place driving around for lunch and landed on a GREAT lunch deal.  2 cheese slices and medium drink for less than 5 bucks!  pizza is good as well.  thin crust and pretty similar to back home (east).  

the place has enough tables to eat there and 2 tvs.  definitely a great lunch spot for only a few bucks.  i'll be back since it's near my office.  plenty of parking although it is in a very busy parking lot.
sooo good!!! i loved it and the fresh ingredients were a plus! i will be def ordering again from them!
Some of the best pizza I have had in Vegas. Been eating it for years. The east side location is in my opinion the best. Go check them out and get the special. You won't regret it.

Great pizza!!! Always on point. Got wings this time and they were disappointing.  No sauce and dry. Got hot and mild, they were not labeled on which was which, and they were lacking flavor.  Won't order again.

First off, the new owner is so friendly and down to earth, super cool guy! Secondly, the food is delicious and the lunch specials are amazing! My boyfriend and I ate for under $15 (drink included)! Definitely will be back.

Worst pizza place ever!! Wings sucked so bad! The old guy making the pizza was picking his nose and tossing pizza dough in the air!!! Then all of the sudden I see this dang mice run across the Side of the wall I said forget that and left. Nasty!!!

This place is one of the best pizza joints I've ever been to!  The pizza is made with the perfect bread to cheese to sauce ratio and toppings are fresh and tasty.  We got the 30 wings and large pizza special.  The staff was very accommodating and gave us samples of all the sauces for the wings on the side.  Hands down best ranch dressing you'll ever taste!  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I felt like the price was a little high.  I mean even though it's delicious it's still only pizza.  We'll be back for sure.

This place has an old style feel to it. There are two main guys who work there and everyone seems to recognize them. They even got a little cartoon on the tip jar that looks just like said 'pizza making' dudes. Guy I dealt with was very nice. White baseball cap. Grey hair. Mustache. Friendly and welcoming. Pretty cool feel for your typical pizza spot...

But the price is f*cking amazing. $11 large pizza? Forget about it. A little greasy(it's a pizza. What do you expect?), but extremely satisfying. Hate to sound like a glutton, but it's one of those "you should just buy the whole pie instead of only a slice" situations.

This was one of the first places that I visited specifically because of the Yelp reviews during my lunch. And it did not disappoint. No disrespect to Pizza Hut or Dominos, but the taste is authentic and the price is right. Don't pass this place up as I'm sure if will be your new favorite pizza spot.

2nd time here cuz pizza is great, but..... as I go to grab a napkin out the napkin dispense a roach popped out.... my husband told the guy up front and they apologized then blamed it on chop sticks next door then offered us a free drink!! REALLY!
Great pizza and ranch! Friendly quick delivery normally there before the 45 minutes they give you.  It's our go to! Order a Hawaiian with jalape√±os and onions!!! You won't be disappointed.

Now IDK pizza, as in I Don't Know pizza. Appropriately named as the new owners make a cold and soggy pizza (I had mine delivered)

So sad, I loved Verrazanos pizza and hoped the new owner would not change a thing. 

Too late. A friend and I ordered our usual for lunch delivery. Quoted 45 minutes. Ok, that's normal. An hour and 15 minutes later no pizza. When it finally came, an hour and half, the pizza was c c cold and soggy. The mushrooms tasted "dirty", like no one washed them before they cooked them.

This is a HUGE disappointment as now I/we have to find a new place for pizza delivery.

Why, why, why would you ruin a good thing and change the quality of a great pizza.

DELICIOUS EGGPLANT PARMESAN SUBS

  I'll take Verrazano over the Subway. Verrazano is a New York pizzaria and sub restaurant named after the World famous suspension bridge connecting Brooklyn to Staten Island. It is a slice of the Big Apple in Bright Light City. It is not their New York pizza but their delicious New York style eggplant parmesan sub that has kept me returning. 

  This Verrazano is located at the southwest corner of Eastern and Windmill in the Smith's-anchored shopping center. As soon as you step inside the small restaurant, you leave Las Vegas for a mom and pop pizza shop. The white walls are covered with pictures of New York City memorbelia. The red booths resemble the New York pizzaria. The scent of baking pizza permeates the small restaurant. The owner, an older man with a grey mustache reminds me of a New York pizzaria owner east of the Hudson River. 

  I have been a regular the past couple of months. The first time I dined here was on a Saturday evening after work.  I made the trip for the eggplant parmesan sub. At the time, they were out of it. So, I went for two slices of New York style pizza with mushrooms. The pizza was good and could give some New York pizzarias a run for the money. The owner was personable referring to me and his customers as "friend." He only charged me for the lunch special. A week later, I made another attempt to try their eggplant parmesan sub. They were not out. This is the equivalent of a New York eggplant parmesan sub with thick slices of egg plant, mouth watering melted parmesan cheese, and toasted bread. It was so delicious that I'd return a few more times. When the owner was here he'd greet me by saying, "hello friend." He'd only charge 50 cents for the fountain Pepsi. Usually the hero took ten minutes, which was well worth it. I'd entertain myself looking up at the overhead TV which played anything from basketball to Cops or looked down at the free Las Vegas newspapers or my phone. The baking that took place in the kitchen put a nice potpourri throughout the room. The last time I returned here, the same owner that called me friend on past visits, didn't greet me or talk to me. When I walked in somebody else took my order and when I handed my Pepsi cup to the owner for a top off, he didn't say anything to me. And this time, I overheard him telling a customer that they ran out of pizza slices. At any rate, I don't visit Verrazano for commaderie.  I make the trip here for one of the dearest foods in my life: the eggplant parmesan sub. 

  I am a fan of the delicious eggplant parmesan sub. Disparate from Subway and Port of Subs where they seem to be in almost every major shopping mall, there are currently few restaurants in Las Vegas that serve eggplant parmesan subs. How many New York pizzarias are there in Vegas? There are only a percentage of this small number that serve eggplant parmesan subs. On account of the fact that  Verrazano is one of the few restaurants serving eggplant parmesan subs, someday I plan to return for more.

I usually get the large cheese pizza and hot fries. This pizza is huge and very tasty!!!! I'm not into hot and spicy things but my fiance is and she loves these fries. I highly suggest giving this place a try if you haven't already.
My favorite authentic NY style pepperoni pizza in Vegas... try the fried ravioli and the cheese steak

After many good years eating Verrazano, it has sadly come to an end.  I'm not sure if they had changed owners or what going on but the last two times I've ordered I was quoted 45 minutes for delivery.  First time (10/31)  it took them an hour 35 and with no apology and I was stuck with $80 of cold soggy pizza.  The second (and last time which was today, 11/22) I was quoted 40 minutes and 1 hour 55 minutes later our food was delivered.  The pizza was cold and soggy, the wings undercooked and the ranch was warm and spoiled.  When the driver finally showed, without an apology he stated they were running behind.  Sorry Verrazano, while we loved you long time, we are now divorced.

Used to eat here many years ago when studying at Nevada School of Massage Therapy. Went in today at 10.30 (they close at 11), their floors were being cleaned and they asked us to stay on one side, we were the only people in there except for one lady with a take out order. 
We ordered two slices with a limited English speaking person and were told $4 by some other guy. No hello, no, are you eating in, no anything else... we added and drink and asked for ranch too late as they had already swiped our card. They asked us to include .60 cents on the tip line when signing. 
Very rude, gives no shits attitudes. They heated our slices ($5.00 total BTW) and packed in a too go 'box'. We pulled them out and ate at a table. They turned off wheel of fortune on the TV and just kind on stared at us until we finished and left by 10.45. 
Rude. 
They only get 1 stars because of the memories. Pizzas not fabulous. Service is horrible.

Ahhhhhhhh Verrazanos! I've neglected you for so long! I was born and raised in Vegas and can Tell you I've been coming here since I was a little kid and yes this place has legit NY style pizza. It's the same as years ago when my mom would come pick up wings and pizza for us. The pizza is perfectly sauces and they're not stingy with the cheese but it's all about the crust. I recommend letting it cool down for a few minutes. I like the crust between crispy and soft. If you eat it too quick you can't full enjoy every component. Slap some oregano and chili flakes on it and you're in pizza heaven. Don't forget to order ranch for your wings I don't know what they out in it but I imagine they have this stuff in heaven it's like liquid gold. Purely delectable. It's a garlic ranch so don't plan on making out with anyone after you'll be sure to scare all the vampires away so no need to worry about Dracula coming for ya! Wings could use more sauce but my mom can't handle spicy so she likes em that way. I wouldn't order the garlic knots again. Boring reheated bread with slight garlic flavor but they weren't fresh. Stick with the pizza you'll be happy you did.
Best tasting pizza around... No doubt when I'm looking for some pies I go and order from here... They've been gracious to me and I can't thank them enough for all their customer service! Thank you!
This place is really going downhill how do you run out of garlic knots at 4 PM you haven't  hit your dinner rush yet!

Never call this location for an order. When you arrive there they will deny they received it!! Then instead of service recovery they will claim that they never received the order and claim you are a liar. I gladly took my money elsewhere!!! The two men working 10/12/15 at 7pm are not working to make money nor satisfy customers!!

We had two slices of pizza salad and garlic knots , the food was outstanding, the staff working were really cool you could tell there from New York and they really brought the style and tradition of New York style pizza to the neighborhood.

GREAT MEATBALL PIZZA!!! I can't tell you how many times I have passed this place but somehow when it comes time to order a pie it never comes to thought. But thanks to great reviews by my fellow yelper squad I actually remembered last night and so happy I did!

It was one of those nights that I was torn between cooking and ordering out. Since I was getting off late and completely famished I opted for the latter. Called them up and ordered. They asked if I would prefer pick up or delivery. They said 15 minutes for pick up or about 45 for delivery. Normally I am already at home and prefer deliver but since I was leaving work and they are located right down the road I opted for pick up. Remember... I was too famished to cook!

What I ordered... I was so tempted to order this eggplant parm pizza. Sounds so amazing but I decided to go a little more traditional the first go around.  Meatball, mushroom, ricotta and basil. Unfortunately, I was informed they were out of fresh basil but could substitute with dehydrated. No thanks! I have a fresh basil plant so no biggie. Pizza was solid! Meatballs were yummy, good quality mushrooms and ricotta. I really liked the crust. Maybe I am nuts but the crust had a bit of a sourdough vibe that I really dug being the Bay Area brat that I am. It was right up my alley! Also got the cannoli! Two thumbs up!

I will definitely order again... I can't stop imagining the possibility of an eggplant parm pizza! Ooh la la!

Terrible customer service. Walked in & was rushed to order.. which it's my first time here, was skimming over the menu & I happily won't be returning. I wanted to order a medium pizza because I was ordering wings as well, but they pressured for a large & I wanted to do toppings so the guy cut me off & was saying how I should order a specialty with everything on it.. which I didn't want everything on it. All around, it was a bad experience once we walked in the door. I don't even care about the food anymore

We love basically everything about this place and it's our go-to for pizza and wings. The pizza is a great, with a thin but chewy crust, and just the right amount of greasy cheesy pepperoni goodness. The wings are awesome also; made with real ingredients and not chock full of stabilizers like the "big box" wing places these days (so gross.) Possibly even better than the food is the customer service. The owner (I think? pretty sure. He's always the same guy who takes our order when we come in...) is quiet at first but then he'll cracks some jokes here and there. But, he really cares about details in things. For example, when you order the bucket of wings, he takes the time to cut out a piece of cardboard to put in the bottom of the paper bag for the cups of ranch, so the bag doesn't collapse and make a mess. Maybe it's a tiny thing but it shows how much they care about details like that.
I don't live here but I know good. Fresh. Handmade pizza and this joint delivers!  I'm sure if I were a regular and knew the menu better I'd give them 5 stars. Enjoy

It started off great. The atmosphere is almost identical with NY style pizzerias. The smell of the pizzas cooking in the oven reminded me of NY. I do have to say that their food was pretty sub-par. The sauce was bland and the cheese was almost non existent. The toppings fell off the pizza and it was almost like eating a crusty old piece of bread with bland sauce and toppings. I do not see how this place is considered even to be remotely NY, other than the vast murals of the Twin Towers, this place has a lot of work to do. I am still looking for the best NY style pizza in Las Vegas and so far this isn't it.

I ordered the White Garlic Pizza: olive oil, mozzarella , ricotta, Romano pizza and it was fantastic.  I usually don't like pizza that much, but order it because everyone else does. Since this pizza, I've been ordering it for myself.  Ordered with the pizza was Antipasto Salad: ham, capicola, salami, tomato, provolone, black olive & pepperoncini. Perfect combo! Each compliment each other.  
I waited until I ordered a couple times before writing the review, just to make sure it was the same each time.
One of the best pizza shops in Las Vegas! I've pretty much have eaten everything on their menu and I liked it all. Tiny little hole in the wall which is what makes it so great
My favorite pizza place in Vegas without a doubt. I've been eating there for many years and about to order delivery as I wrote this!
